titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for an income tax credit for in-State contributions to congressional candidates.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a tax credit for contributions to candidates for congressional offices for the State of which the taxpayer is a resident. Limits such contribution to $100 ($200 in the case of a joint return). Disallows such credit for an estate or trust.
